newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai interbank rate rises, baht firmer late.
newsitem.headline: Thai interbank rate rises, baht firmer late.

text.p: The Thai overnight interbank rate rose to 13.00-13.50 percent in late trade on Thursday from 12.25-12.50 earlier on tighter liquidity, dealers said.
"The demand for funds was very high today especially from finance firms. Most finance firms were borrowing funds to meet the reserve requirement due today," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
Finance companies have to meet the Bank of Thailand's reserve requirement every Thursday.
Dealers said a smaller amount of funds lent into the market by state-run Government Saving Bank, a major market lender, was another factor that tightened money supply.
The finace ministry on Tuesday assigned the Government Saving Bank to set up a 10-billion-baht fund to be used to buy stocks that might be forced sold by brokerages on the depressed stockmarket.
The baht firmed to 25.377-25.387 to the dollar late from 25.385-25.390 earlier as the dollar eased abroad, dealers said.
The one-month swap premium was at 11.00/11.50 satangs per dollar late compared with 9.75/10.50 earlier.
The tightness in baht supply and rising short-term money market rates were cited as reasons for the higher premiums.
The mid-rate was fixed at 25.38 to the dollar against 25.37 on Wednesday. It was the lowest fix since July 15.
